params.content: The content hash to apply the patch to.

returns.composedId: The identifier of the composed patch.

params.effect: The encoded effect of the patch.

returns.patchId: The unique identifier of the created patch.

returns.inversePatchId: The identifier of the new inverse patch.

applyPatch(bytes32,bytes32).notice: Applies a patch to content, emitting the result.

commute(bytes32,bytes32).notice: Attempts to commute two patches, producing reordered equivalents.

compose(bytes32,bytes32).notice: Composes two sequential patches into one. Requires first.target == second.base.

create(bytes32,bytes32,bytes).notice: Creates a new patch representing a change from base to target.

getPatch(bytes32).notice: Retrieves a patch record by ID.

invert(bytes32).notice: Creates the inverse of a patch by swapping base and target.
